title: 109_s3583
content: REGULATION OF PAYROLL TAX DEPOSIT AGENTS: An amendment to Chapter 77 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 introduces a new section, SEC. 7529, regarding payroll tax deposit agents. The Secretary will establish a system for the registration and renewal of payroll tax deposit agents, including fees, bonding or audit options, required disclosures, and ensuring direct deposits. The system for registration and renewal of payroll tax deposit agents will include requirements for disclosures, direct notification of employers by tax authorities, and penalties for noncompliance. The system for registration and renewal of payroll tax deposit agents will include requirements for disclosures, direct notification of employers by tax authorities, and penalties for noncompliance. A payroll tax deposit agent is defined as a person providing payroll processing or tax services to employers with authority to access funds for tax deposits. The system for registration and renewal of payroll tax deposit agents includes bonding requirements for payroll tax deposit agents who elect to submit a bond. The bond amount must be between $50,000 and $500,000, and annual audits may be required for compliance. Annual audits for payroll tax deposit agents who elect to submit to them must be conducted by an independent third party. The audits should ensure that the agent's escrow account is balanced yearly, funds are not mixed with operating funds, and no funds are used for the agent's expenses. The Secretary requires payroll tax deposit agents to disclose to clients their liability for employment taxes and mechanisms to verify tax deposits. The Secretary mandates that payroll tax deposit agents must disclose clients' liability for employment taxes and provide mechanisms to verify tax deposits. Only registered individuals can make federal tax deposits and file federal employment tax returns on behalf of employers. The Secretary requires registered individuals to handle federal tax deposits, file employment tax returns, and access confidential tax information for employers. Regulations will be prescribed as needed. Payroll tax deposit agents are subject to penalties for failure to collect or pay taxes. The Code of 1986 is amended to include payroll tax deposit agents as defined in section 7529(a)(2). This amendment does not affect the interpretation of section 6672 of the Internal Revenue Code. Additionally, the table of sections for chapter 77 is updated with a new item. The amendments made by section 7529, regarding payroll tax deposit agents, will take effect upon the enactment of the Act. Penalties for failures will apply after the enactment date.
